name: Water Sprite
description: Ceratopteris thalictroides, commonly known as Water Sprite, Water Fern, or Indian Fern, is a fast-growing aquatic and semi-aquatic fern native to tropical and subtropical regions worldwide, including Southeast Asia, Africa, Australia, and the Americas. It belongs to the Pteridaceae family and features highly variable, deeply divided, feathery fronds (15-100 cm long) that can be submerged or emersed. When grown submerged, the leaves are typically more finely divided and feathery, while emersed leaves are broader and less divided. The fronds are bright green and grow from a central rosette. This plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit and can reach 15-100 cm in height. It produces spores on the underside of fronds for reproduction. In its native habitat, it grows in shallow water, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant provides lush, feathery texture and excellent water filtration. It's extremely popular in aquariums for its fast growth and ability to provide cover and shade.
